    • Method Detail

      • getSimilarity

        float getSimilarity(java.lang.Object o1,
                  java.lang.Object o2)
        Calculates the distance between objects using the distance function for k = 0, using . If it has not been computed previously it is computed and stored now.
        Parameters:
        o1 - Object 1 to compute
        o2 - Object 2 to compute
        Returns:
        the distance as float from [0, infinite)

      • getSimilarity

        float getSimilarity(int index1,
                  int index2)
        Calculates the Similarity between objects using the Similarity function for k = 0, using . If it has not been computed previously it is computed and stored now.
        Parameters:
        index1 - index of first object to compute
        index2 - index of second object to compute
        Returns:
        the Similarity as float from [0, infinite)

      • getMaximumSimilarity

        int getMaximumSimilarity(int row)
        Used for the heuristic for getting the pivots as described in the paper. This method calls with parameters (row, 0, null, null).
        Parameters:
        row - defines the row where we want to find the maximum
        Returns:
        the index of the object with maximum Similarity to the row object.

      • getMinimumSimilarity

        int getMinimumSimilarity(int row)
        Returns the index of the col with minimum similarity to the given row
        Parameters:
        row - defines the row where we want to find the minimum
        Returns:
        the index of the object with minimum Similarity to the row object.

        Returns the dimension of the matrix
